input_text:
Job Title: Recruiter

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Health Care Provider, Other

Description:
What we do:Since 2010 we’ve helped 100+ companies across the healthcare space hire hundreds of employees, and our clients range from fortune 500 Hospital Systems to innovative start-up Health Plans! We most frequently recruit clinicians- think Nurses, Therapists, etc. We have a ridiculously talented business development team, and we've recently been turning away searches because our recruiters are at capacity with job reqs. A good problem to have, but a problem nonetheless!
The Perks:Work from home - must be willing to work PSTMedical, dental, vision- most plans are completely free for an individualUnlimited Time Off, including a week off from Christmas to New Years4 company-paid sessions with a Mental Health Therapist/year401k with up to $2,500 in employer matching1 free book/month or audible.com subscription
Your job:It's simple; we provide the clients and manage the relationships, you find the candidates. We make lot's of placements and everybody wins.At any given time you can expect to have 10-20 open "reqs" to fillYou'll source and recruit for a wide variety of healthcare "temp" positions ranging from Medical Assistants and Front Desk Coordinators, to Clinicians (Therapists, Nurses, etc.), Accounting and Finance to Administrative roles13 paid recruitment tools at your disposal
How we win:I. Team Success: our top priority is to create a system that facilitates: Balance, Sustainable Income, Fun, & Growth for our team.II. Client Success: we are driven to help clients hire “team members” who make a meaningful impact. We do this by making introductions to “off market candidates” and while taking a consultative approach to the talent acquisition process.
Training:We love teaching and have a comprehensive 30-day onboarding plan to introduce you to our tools, processes, and clients (and then some on top of that!)- this is a great job for someone who enjoys learning and is excited about recruitment & talent acquisition.
***Qualifications.At least 1+ years of healthcare staffing or recruitment experience.Able to work PST time zone hours.Being comfortable with technology (i.e. Excel, Outlook, LinkedIn), aren’t afraid of making cold calls (yes, we have realistic expectations, and will teach you what to say), and have a "sales" mindset and get a rush when you imagine closing multiple roles in one day plus extra fees for conversions.
If this sounds like your cup of tea, only send your resume to Kaylin@AMINetwork.com with a blurb about why you think this job is a good fit, what's an area of your life personally or professionally you're looking to improve. A creative subject line will get you extra credit, and for more bonus points we'd love to hear an interesting fact about yourself!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Recruiter
output_json.summary: Helping 100+ companies across the healthcare space hire hundreds of employees.

Fill 10-20 open'reqs' at any given time

4 company-paid sessions with a Mental Health Therapist/year
401k with up to $2,500 in employer matching

Being comfortable with technology (i.e. Excel, Outlook, LinkedIn), aren’t afraid of making cold calls (yes, we have realistic expectations, and will teach you what to say), and have a'sales' mindset and get a rush when you imagine closing multiple roles in one day plus extra fees for conversions.
